item.title: Basic data structures - Array
item.description: 189. Rotate Array class Solution: def rotate(self, nums: List[int], k: int) -> None: """ Do not return anything, modify nums in-place instead. """ k %= len(nums) nums[:] = nums[::-1] nums[:k] = nums[:k][::-1] nums[k:] = nums[k:][::-1] The simplest way is rotate nums three times. Python support rotate directly, but Java do not have corresponding function.
